Bones CSS

Documentation Github

Simple, Elegant, Lightweight, CSS boilerplate

Styling plain html elements. No css classes to remember.
Did my best to make it look good. Suggestions are still welcome though ðŸ˜‰
Less than 600 lines of code
Great for quick prototypes or tutorials, locally or on codesandbox, gitpod, stackblitz, etc
Inspired by Skeleton, Water.CSS, tailwindcss, 1-line layouts

Is Bones CSS for you?

You should use Bones CSS if you're embarking on a smaller project or just don't feel like you need all the utility of larger frameworks. Bones only styles a handful of standard HTML elements and includes a simple grid, but that's often more than enough to get started. In fact, this site is built entirely on Bones CSS and nothing else.

If you like Bones, feel free to Star it or raise an issue or a suggestion here Issue

How to use

Simply Copy&Paste the following code in the <head> of your index.html 

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@alex.radulescu/bones-css@0.10.0/dist/bones.7203b13b.css" />

Made with love by Alex
